Reviews.Title: “Best value for money”
Reviews.Author: Nissemainj
Reviews.Content: Great location with Kürfurstendamm strasse and U-bahn a short walk nearby. The Studio apartment covers all needs with its kitchen facilities, trendy look and diverce solutions. A little dissapointed of the hardness of the bed and the lack of WiFi though. All in all, we felt that it was great value for the money spent.

Reviews.Title: “Three weeks”
Reviews.Author: Magdalena M
Reviews.Content: I'm just back after over 3 weeks in the Adagio. The studio was fine, very modern, clean, the space was well used. It was sufficient for 1 maybe 2 people max. There were few maintenance issues, and everybody seemed to experiance some issues with internet conection. Once you arrive you should ask for a cable but you will only be able to use the internet at the desk. When it works its good, when it doesnt, it doesnt and i usually abandoned my computer for few hours. There is wifi in the lobby. I had some issues with cleaning. Sometimes i would be left with 4 towels, sometimes just two, sometimes there would be no bin bags in the bin. the electricity card would be taken out and laptop would go out of charge. Small things. The self service washing machine costs 6eur, you get a tablet/powder for it. Dryer is 3 Eur. It works on time so this buys you two hour use of each.The bed is big and comfy but the pillows are square and not great. I must admit the staff seems a bit not interested and wont go out of their way or anything but they are not rude. Over all despite the small issues described above I would recomend the hotel even for a long stay. Ps. there is a little Italian restaurant near hotel called Pizza Factory and its quite cheap but nice.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, fairly convenient, very reasonable”
Reviews.Author: OldMaineTravelers
Reviews.Content: We stayed 10 days in a two-room apartment, which was very comfortable for two persons — worth the extra cost. One of us could use a computer while the other rested. We toured the city extensively using public transit, which is fairly convenient to the hotel (five minutes to a bus stop, and, if you can figure out the system, you can connect to almost anywhere). We ate a good lunch almost daily and mostly had a light supper in the apartment because we were bushed by evening. There is an excellent supermarket just minutes away. Not many appealing restaurants really near. The staff was pleasant and helpful. I don't know why some people complain about lack of cleaning — you don't usually get daily maid service at home and should not make such a terrible mess anyway. We have been very pleased with the Accor Adagio hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Family Apartment Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ami130
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite new and built in a modern style. Apartment for 4 is indeed spacious enough for the needs of a family with two children. Two flat TV screens, audio system, fully equipped kitchen, plenty of storage space, iron, hair dryer and restroom separated from the bathroom are on the advantages side. Add to that an o.k. location as the hotel is within a walking distance from the Kurfurstendamm (250m) or Europa Center (1000M). Public transportation is also within walking distance: Uhlandstraße (U1) is approx 600m away, Adenauerplatz (U7) is approx 800m and Savignyplatz (S-Bahn) is approx 800m as well. On the down side are the cleaning policy of "weekly or end of stay cleaning" which practically means no cleaning during a tourist stay. Coffee or tea are not provided so make sure to bring or buy some. Internet is free in the room using a wired connection. Having your own cable is preferred as the one provided by the hotel (for free!) had both plastic latches broken. Pricewise the hotel is not a bargain either so overall value is on the average.

Reviews.Title: “Great apartment in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Tourist75
Reviews.Content: These apartments are good located just of Kurfurstendamm in a quiet street (we didn´t experience any noise from other guests or street). Close to shopping area and restaurants and just a few minutes walk to the U-bahn stop Uhlandstrasse. There is a good grocery store just across the street from the hotel. The apartment was clean and modern. We had a one bedroom apartment (and a double sofa bed in the living room). The kitchen was very small, but very well equipped; Frigde, micro wave, dish washer and cooking possibilites (no oven). Nice bathroom, good shower and warm water. The apartment had a lot of closets for storage which is good if you´re staying for a while. The apartment isn´t cleaned every day. Only once a week I think, but you can pay extra to get this done. I had no problem with that as I only stayed for a few days. The staff was very helpful and nice. All in all, I have nothing negative to say about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “At the end neither a bargain nor a winner - some issues to consider”
Reviews.Author: Dudel
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed with this hotel, for various reasons. Value-wise it is okay, but not a real bargain. First of all, the standard rooms are advertised as studio apartments with sleeping and living area - well it is a do-it-yourself "living" area, made possible through folding a foldaway bed and the placing pillows at the back of the cupboard. Speaking of the foldaway bed, it was uncomfortably hard with a foam mattress on a rudimentry statted frame not providing enough ventilation for a mattress of this kind. Sleeping quality was not good. Thirdly, though the kitchen was fully equipped, there was no coffee or tea provided for the guests. I asked if it was forgotten and was told that it is a self-catering hotel and that it has to be bought by the guests. I don't understand why for the cost of less than a Euro a day one would upset customers. Forthly, the staff was really kind and tried hard to be helpful, but every question we asked was answered with, "wait a second, I'll google it for you". It is okay for the most part, but when we asked how to get to the airport by public transportation we got the same answer. I would be amazed, if we were the first to ask this question. This hotel is rated as a 4 star hotel, well I am sure it meets all the criterias necessary, but it just doesn't feel like it. On the positive side, the small kitchen and the bathroom were very nice, even though the bathroom designer favoured fanciness over functionality, but okay. The rooms were tidy, and having a iron and a iron board in the room was handy. Location is good.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a family stay”
Reviews.Author: LondonTelegramSam
Reviews.Content: Most hotels, 99.9%, oblige you to take 2 rooms when you are traveling in a group of 4. Thankfully, there are initiatives such as these from Accor, who also have the Suites Novotel concept by the way, to become a bit more client responsive. As it is new, it is also in a very good state. The staff are friendly and I keep going back there, even if I am on my own, because it is always practical to have a little kitchen and a sofa/living room area rather than always lying on the bed to watch tv.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, well positioned, quiet and warm!”
Reviews.Author: seeitonbusiness
Reviews.Content: Easy to find modern hotel with handy underground car park (but costs - 37.00 eur for 3 nights). Very handy for the Messe (for the trade show), bit of a ride into town but not too bad. Nice area, lots of eateries and entertainments nearby, plus the Edega store over the road. Standard hotel room but with extra lobby/galley kitchen, including 2 ring hob, microwave with grill, dishwasher, large fridge and extractor. Bliss! Able to supply own breakfast in my room at last!! Nice bathroom - shower only - wifi in lobby, flat screen TV (limited English language options though), two lifts, no porter, also no carpeting in the room (just hard floors).

Reviews.Title: “Simple with good location”
Reviews.Author: Susan L
Reviews.Content: Berlin is generally a cheaper city than other European cities I've traveled to, and this hotel was pretty well-priced. It was a good location, somewhat spacious, and the kitchen was nice, but the price was the same cost as the tiny hostel I booked in Paris a few weeks before. Good value for your money. The room seems like an example of classic German efficiency: the bed folds neatly into the wall to reveal a couch. The kitchen was small but sufficient; we bought groceries at Edeka which was closeby. Bathroom products were limited but I think that's why the hotel is cheap. Another strange feature of the hotel is that they don't change the bedsheets unless you want to pay extra. I imagine this is another reason why the hotel is so cheap. Overall, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good option travelling with family”
Reviews.Author: soniawasabi
Reviews.Content: This apart hotel is in a quiet alley 200 meters away from Kurfursterdam. A great place to go shopping and to take the U-Bahn. Also near Savigny Platz a beautiful place full of resturants and the S-Banh station. The hotel is new, modern and confortable. The rooms are medium size but have everything you need if you want to have dinner or breakfast.The staff is helpful and the reception area has plenty of touristic information, a computer for guests and a laundry room (very useful). I was travelling with my husband and 2 teenager sons and it was great for us!

Reviews.Title: “A great stay in a good location”
Reviews.Author: drew22PerthAustralia Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Everthing about the Adagio was great, the only slight let down was some information I asked for at reception was inaccurate and a TV problem. The receptionist told me that all cinema films in Berlin were only in German, when in fact the Sony Cinestar Centre shows film in there original language regularly, I found this out from the hotel internet so it was no big deal, but rather than say no, say I don't know, the other problem was that the advertised English Channels on the TV were not available, in fact all the cable wasn't available, when I queried this and asked if it would be available I was told in a rather surly fashion that he had no idea when the problem would be resolved or what the problem was and gave the impression he didn't much care. However these were the only two insignificant negatives of the stay. Everything about the hotel, its location, facilities, etc were very good and exceptional value.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice & inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: Liverpool_UKLaura
Reviews.Content: This place was quite easy to find and cheap too which is always a bonus! Its about a 5-10 minute walk to Uhlandstrasse station and about 15 min walk to Savignyplatz train station. Lots of shops/supermarket and restaurants nearby and there was a large christmas market in Kurfurstdamm up the road. I feel if you want to be in the thick of things or if you are only visiting for a short while, maybe freidrichstrsse or alexanderplatz might be a better to stay as some of the attractions are closer, but otherwise i have no critisms. The apartments were very clean, mordern and well maintained. With a little kitchenette with kettle/fridge/cooker and cutlery etc. The bed also lifts up into the wall to create more space through the day. Overall i would stay again, you cant fault it for the price. We didn't bother with the breakfasts as we just bought food and ate in our room.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: jhuprincess
Reviews.Content: great little hotel, tucked away in a nice residential area, and very close to food. loved the little kitchen. we only used it to heat up food we bought, and breakfast though. room was clean, loved the bathroom. great reception desk. close to transportation. loved it. will go back again. hope all the adagio apart hotel are as nice as this one!

Reviews.Title: “Well-situated hotel”
Reviews.Author: OscarTammy
Reviews.Content: This modern "business" hotel actually offers a lot to the vacation traveller as well. It is very well positioned just one block back from the K'Damm, the iconic shopping and entertainment street of Berlin, and only 10 minutes walk from the lively Savignyplatz restaurant and shopping area, and the Savignyplatz train staion giving easy access to the rest of Berlin. My room had a small well-equipped kitchenette, which, with two supermarkets a block away, made preparing odd meals very easy. However there are plenty of restaurants nearby if you don't want to cook. The front desk staff were extremely helpful with little problems such as the cable TV not receiving English channels - quickly fixed. Free Wi-fi in the ground floor area actually made for quite a convivial atmosphere as people brought their computers and iPhones down to the lounge area.

Reviews.Title: “Great business/tourist stay”
Reviews.Author: Ard70
Reviews.Content: Been staying in this hotel for 8 nights, because I was attending a conference in the ICC. I really appreciate the idea of having your private 'apartment' inside the hotel. Since I was staying for an extended period, I booked the 4-person room, offering me a bed room and separate living room. Facilities were very good, but be aware that cleaning only takes place once a week if you're staying 4 nights or longer, this includes changing linen/towels. Extra cleaning can be arranged at extra cost. The wired internet was good, but I don't like the fact that you have to use a 'web login' page to be able to use it. However, this is the case in most hotels. Big bathroom, separate toilet. Shower was hot, except during busy times, where the water temperature was considerably lower, but still (barely) acceptable. Make sure to get an early shower in the mornings! Very close to Kurfurstendamm, but bit further away from S-bahn or U-bahn. Not a real problem for me.

Reviews.Title: “Modern apartment in great location”
Reviews.Author: aussie_lander Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and were very impressed. Pro's - excellent location, close to restaurants, cafes and shopping. Great room size with the added bonus of a small kitchen (although no toaster!). Excellent value for money. Cons - There was construction noise from the site directly opposite the hotel and were woken at 7am on weekdays. Ask if you can stay on the opposite side to avoid this. After a few days our shower was covered in soap scum. As the apartments are only serviced weekly, this could be a problem for those who choose to stay more than a few days. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel - I don't know why anyone would want to stay in Mitte!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: markmalina8899
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights for the first stop in out European tour, and it was a great start! The complimentary wi-fi and breakfast were big bonuses, because we had a very hungry teenager! Being really close to the Kurfürstendamm made the stay even better and it was four minutes walk to the nearest U-bahn. I really recommend this Hotel

Reviews.Title: “great deal”
Reviews.Author: italiantraveller25
Reviews.Content: we stayed there during the summer and took advantage of a summer-discounted price. The hotel is modern and clean, the double room is perfect for 2 people, with a good space for storing clothes. The rooms have a fully equipped (fridge, 2 cooking plates, little dishwasher, microwave, kettle, coffeemaker, cups, mugs, plates, glasses) little kitchen too, that make this hotel perfect also for longer stays. The staff was nice and gave us all the information we needed. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel. We definitely recommend this place both for tourism both for business.

Reviews.Title: “Great apartment”
Reviews.Author: Achim K
Reviews.Content: Great value for your money because of here service is excellent. Easy to get there by bus from the airport. Walking distance from the zoo.There was two good supermarkets near easy fulfill our requirements.

Reviews.Title: “A cool apartment hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: SiviPanda
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I visited this great hotel a year ago in October. We enjoyed it so much that we are planing to visit it again, this December for our honeymoon (already made a reservation). * Great location in Kurfurstendamm. * Rooms (which are more like small apartments) are very cozy and well equipped. * Hotel staff is really helpful and kind. * Great atmosphere and beautiful design. * Excellent price - you get a lot for what you pay. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “very, very good”
Reviews.Author: Jack Z
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel very much. The rooms for two persons are rather big, renovated, with all necessary kitchen equipment, comfortable bed.Our room was at the first floor on the back side and was very quiet (but there is a contraction from the opposit side, near the hotel entrance). There was two good supermarkets near the hotel. U-bahn station Savinyu-platz is about 10-15 minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “More than what I expected.”
Reviews.Author: detijuana
Reviews.Content: Easy to get there by bus from the airport. Walking distance from the zoo. Easy access tp public transportation. Rooms are big for Europe. Service is excellent. Great value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “It was a very comfortable apartment and we would go back anytime”
Reviews.Author: Brendajane
Reviews.Content: The apartment was in a good location and very well designed. The bed was really comfortable and the bedroom itself was spacious. Thre was a good supermarket just across the street which was really handy.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, arty, and brilliant value”
Reviews.Author: Aussiewanderer7
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying in Accor's Adagio brand serviced apartments and it was such a great experience that I have already booked several more stays at Accor hotels and serviced apartments in Europe. I was initially hesitant to book an Accor property because I have stayed in several Accor properties in Asia and the standard was 3 star at best. However, Adagio is the absolute opposite. It is ultra modern, arty, and well designed. It looks brand new. The studio was one of the most spacious I have ever stayed in and the kitchen was well-equipped. A computer (a Mac) and printer in the lounge area are available for guest use free or charge. The supermarket across the road was very convenient. The only downside is that West Berlin/Kudamm is not so central and the area is a little boring. I would have preferred to stay in Mitte or Prenzlauer, but those areas do not have many self-contained apartments and those that are there are significantly more expensive. The subway is about a 7 minute walk from Adagio and you can get everywhere on the subway. A dept store, Ku De Wa, with excellent food courts on its upper levels is 2 stops by train or a 20 minute walk. Overall, Adagio is unbeatable value. Tip: important to know that it's behind the Abba hotel as it doesn't have its own street frontage and can be difficult to find particularly if arriving by taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: doug b
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good . staff and services are excellent, I can't think of anything I didn't liked here.If you want a pleasant stay in Berlin this is the hotel for you. KA DE WE is 5 minutes away from the hotel. A truly excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, stylish and a great location”
Reviews.Author: queenofmaps
Reviews.Content: Location was just five minutes walk from the popular Ku'Damm with it's shops and U-Bahn stations. The buses to and from the airport also run along the Ku'Damm, even in the middle of the night if you have an early flight. Hotel room was spotless and had stylish decor with lots of storage and a comfy bed. I particularly liked having a safe within the room. This hotel is an "Apart Hotel" so rooms have a kitchenette. This was very useful meaning you could make your own breakfast and snacks if you liked. Our slight issue was that workmen are currently renovating a building next door and made noise quite early in the morning but on the positive it gets you up to make the most of your stay so it didn't spoil things! Besides, there is an incredible amount of building work going on in Berlin anyway so I expect many hotels have a crane next door to them so I'm not going to mark the hotel down for that as it's beyond their control. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very little wrong with it”
Reviews.Author: ciderchris82 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great apartments with a modern feel, lots of wardrobe space, a large kitchen and bathroom. Also free WiFi in the reception area. Just a couple of gripes: rooms only get serviced daily if your stay is 3 nights or shorter, but not at all if you're staying a week? A full towel change costs €6 so you're expected to use the same towels all week... Shower design means the bathroom floor inevitably gets wet. This was my first stay at an Adagio and I would definitely stay again and recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Excelent option in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: MorganaHifeng
Reviews.Content: Very nice place - you get a clean, modern, spacious room with a kitchenett and a bathroom. The price is good, and the location in very convenient - near the metro (Uhlanderstrasse station). I will definitively stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice App. Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Really nice appartment hotel, ideal for families with young children. Spacious rooms with good furniture. Only stayed there for one night, but would absolutely choose this hotel again. Can reccoment this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: Bebeku83
Reviews.Content: I went to Berlin with my husband and we really love this aparthotel. A day before the we came, we searched around on how to get to the hotel because it was our first time to Berlin. So I emailed the hotel and in minutes they replied us back and told us which bus to take from the airport complete with the map of the airport bus-stop. The location was superb, not to far from Ku'damn and it's just fantastic. The room it self was nice. We love the size of the room. The bed was comfy and the kitchen functioned really nicely. We actually cooked lunch one time in the room and it was nice. They provided a computer at the lobby area and also a printer so it was easy for us to searched some info about the city and printed it out. We enjoyed our stay there and we definitely gonna come back when we visit Berlin again.

Reviews.Title: “We were very impressed with the value for money”
Reviews.Author: p6403240
Reviews.Content: Excellent apartment, good location (near K-dam, but very quiet). Very well equiped kitchen' comfortable bed. A bit hard to find late at night, but the signs dotted along the road were helpfull. We liked all

Reviews.Title: “very good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: andrews65
Reviews.Content: Stayed five nights in this hotel, May 2011. Overall we were very please with the choice; the only slight drawback being the location ... its fine for the former West Berlin, and the sights on and around the Ku'damm ... but we ended up spending most of our time in the new centre i.e. Mitte, which needed an S-Bahn or U-Bahn trip of 20 mins to half an hour every time. This was not so much of a problem however, as Berlin's transport is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: vtely
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with the value for money. In addition to the bonus of free internet, the room had a full kitchen area, a roomy sleeping area, and a nice bathroom. The staff was very welcoming and accommodating, and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel,bad air con”
Reviews.Author: pdaly05
Reviews.Content: Was in a really good location and was very clean. Staff were helpful. Less than a minute from main street of Kurfurstendamm with plenty of shops,bars and restaurants. Only gripe was the air con was useless even at its coldest setting so didnt get the best of sleeps but Berlin is great so it didnt matter too much! Beautiful architecture everywhere. check out the beach bar beside checkpoint charlie, great day!

Reviews.Title: “Facilites, Location, Price.... what more can you ask for?”
Reviews.Author: fahrinandi Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with 2 other colleagues for a week. The room was spacious, well furnished and equipped, clean. The kitchen is a plus. Locationwise, it's just walking distance from Ku-Dam area where almost everything happens there. Food was easy to find. They could've charged more for their class of service and rooms.... Really.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay here again in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: OregonMs
Reviews.Content: What a luxury to wake up and make my own coffee. Couldn't beat the location, close to two subway lines, restaurants galore. Traveling as a solo woman, I always felt safe and secure. The rooms are cute, well thought out, the kitchens quite efficient. Tons of shopping nearby including two grocery stores. The TV included Brit, Russian, French and Japanese news in English, no American (no CNN). Worked for me, it was great to see what the rest of the world is thinking. I took a cab to the airport in the early AM (Tegal) of my departure worked out great. The bed was hard, but that's Europe. No complaints here. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent apartment for the money”
Reviews.Author: HolidaymadSolihull
Reviews.Content: We first stayed at an Adobe apartment in Bordeaux and we impressed. I therefore searched specifically for an Adobe in Berlin. This is a modern aparthotel (street view actually shows it as a building site) and the facilities in the apartment were excellent. The staff were extremely helpful and when asked to recommend a restaurant for german food, told us of one a very short stroll away, which was exceptionally reasonable and good. There is a building site next door, but we were allocated an apartment as far away from it as was possible (without us asking). It was very quiet and we were not bothered by any street noise or from the building site. The apartment was clean, well equiped, warm and comfortable. The nearest supermarket is only about 100 metres away. A bus stop to catch the 109/110 to the zoo, where the S Bann runs to take your quickly to all the sights was only a 5min stroll away and a U Bann station no more than a few minutes more. We bought a 72 hour Berlin Card from which we got the full value from the travel and discounts. As we bought one which covered Potsdam, we also used it to return to the airport. I would certainly recomment the Fat Tyres Bike tour. It took us to all the main sites on very easy to pedal bikes and our guide was very knowledgeable and funny. All the guides, I think, speak English as their first language, so you get a full commentary. I certainly don't think we would have covered the distance on one walking guided tour. The whole thing, including a stop for lunch, took about 5 hours and was well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “one of my favourites!!”
Reviews.Author: barbaraClau
Reviews.Content: Very good place to stay in Berlin- just what I was looking for! Comfortable and professional service, I will certainly stay again in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay, Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: DavidWWhite
Reviews.Content: New, clean, neat, well-equipped, conveniently located. If you are into shopping, you have the Ku'daam almost at your doorstep. A few blocks down at Savignyplatz there is a great bunch of restaurants and a couple of jazz clubs. Transit is a breeze--choose the S or the U with a few blocks of walking, or take a bunch of buses on Ku'daam. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Restaurant which served breakfast was not a great value--walk a few blocks for more variety and a better price. I would go back without hesitation, and will look for other ones just like this. They have a chain. One note: The picture of the exercise room did not match my expectation. No weights.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, friendly & helpful staff, great rooms”
Reviews.Author: bramleyKent
Reviews.Content: We so enjoyed our stay in this aparthotel. My teenage daughter and I shared a studio which was clean, bright, modern and well kitted out. The staff were very friendly and there is a host of local information including guide books and papers you can peruse in the lounge area. This was our first visit to Berlin and we felt very comfortable in the area. We'd recommend starting your visit with the Story of Berlin museum which is an easy 10 mins walk away and then from there you can wander down Ku'damn, the main shopping street from then Berlin's your oyster. There is a very local supermarket for self catering needs and plenty of local restaurants towards Savignay Platz. Would def stay in another one of this chain.

Reviews.Title: “We would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: jaelke
Reviews.Content: We booked this aparthotel after reading the TripAdvisor reviews - and were not disappointed. Hints such as it is located behind the Abba Hotel were helpful, although there are several signs on the road to indicate. We found the studio very stylish, clean and the furniture very versatile. (For example, there is table under the desk which can be used for dining, and the fold-up bed, which we found very comfortable, converted into a settee, making much more space for the day time.) There is plenty of storage space as well as an iron and ironing board and safe. The room was also very quiet, even though at one stage we had a 'Pavarotti' next door, who seemed to be rehearsing for Mozart's Titus! It sounded very good though - and it was midday! The kitchen has a large fridge, hot plates, dishwasher, kettle and combination microwave, although it would have limited use for grilling or baking as no metal trays very provided. Fine for reheating bought meals, though. As mentioned by others, it is impossible to use the shower without getting the floor wet. To this end a cloth or mop in the bathroom would have been appreciated. One previous reviewer mentioned he wasn't 'told' what to do with his rubbish. Cannot understand this problem as there are very clear signs saying 'Garbage', leading to a bin room at the end of the corridor - you don't even need to go outside. We found the location absolutely fine. The nearest U Bahn is approximately 5 minutes away, S Bahn just a little further. However, even nearer, there are very regular buses that go along the Ku'damm in the direction of the zoo. If you change there, you can catch the 100 or 200 bus which takes you to many of the tourist points. Public transport is relatively cheap and seemed very efficient. There are two supermarkets (Edeka and Kaiser) very close by. The staff were very efficient, professional and friendly. We also found it very convenient to leave our luggage on the final day in their secure luggage room. As well as the Apple computer terminal and printer in the lounge, there are also leaflets and guidebooks, newspapers and German magazines such as Stern, Focus and OK.

Reviews.Title: “Good room for the money, but a bit too far from the U-bahn”
Reviews.Author: paperfree
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because it was reasonably close to the U-bahn line my husband needed to be on for work, it got good reviews on tripadvisor, and it was cheap. SERVICE: We arrived early but check-in time wasn't until 2pm so we left our bags in the luggage room and dozed on the sofa, then used their free wireless in the lobby (which worked well) to read up on Berlin. I thought they might yell at us for sleeping in their lobby but they didn't say a word. I was grateful because we were exhausted. By noon they found us a room (a studio). Check-out time is noon, but they let us keep our luggage in the (locked) luggage room all day, and called us a cab when we asked. Overall the service was efficient and professional. ROOM and BED: The apartment was very clean and modern looking. The bed was a Queen-sized fold-down bed, which some tripadvisor reviewers found too hard, but we liked it just fine. We never tried folding it up, but you would need to if you want to set up a dining table or sofa. I was expecting a slightly bigger room for an "apartment hotel" but it was big enough for us. I liked having a tea kettle, silverware, glasses, and a fridge, but we never tried cooking in the oven/microwave or on the two burner stove. NOISE and TEMPERATURE: The room was quite warm even without the heat on, but we just opened a window and the temperature was fine. There was construction going on outside our window, and although we could hear it once we woke up, it never interfered with our sleep. If you are a light sleeper you might inquire about it though--I suspect it will be going on for a while and could be louder in other rooms. (We were on the 5th floor.) MAID SERVICE: There was no maid service until check-out, which was fine with me. The floor did get a bit gritty since we weren't good about taking our shoes off. There was a vacuum in the closet if you wanted to clean the floor yourself. If you want maid service or clean towels you have to pay extra. They did give us free extra pillows though, after we asked. BATHROOM: The bathroom had a very nice modern shower with plenty of hot water and good pressure (but no bath). Also, as other reviewers have mentioned, the shower is open at the back so water leaks onto the floor. If you're careful, though, not too much water gets out. Just don't leave clothes on the floor when you're showering! The bathroom also had a nice magnifying mirror and a hair dryer. INTERNET: The lobby includes free wireless internet which works well. There's no wireless in the rooms though. The rooms includes free wired internet, however, and the front desk will give you a LAN cable if you ask, but it's quite short. You have to use your computer at the desk not the bed, and only one person can use it at a time. Also, every time you close the computer or leave the room (in which case you have to pull your room card and the power goes out), you have to re-log into their internet service, which is a bit annoying. But otherwise the internet worked fine. FOOD: We never tried the breakfast because other reviewers said it was overpriced. There are lots of cafes in the area though. FITNESS CENTER: The fitness center has a treadmill, an elliptical, and an exercise bike, but no weight machines. COST: 72 euros a night. Pretty cheap. LOCATION: The location was our least favorite aspect of the hotel. Although it looks close to several U-bahn stations on the map, once we were there we found them all a bit too far away. And the hotel is not close to any of the really big U-bahn stops that serve several lines. Maybe in the summer it would be fine but in the chilly October weather we wished we were more centrally located. OVERALL: If you're planning to stay in this area, the Adagio hotel is an excellent choice (except for the lack of wireless in the rooms). But next time we will probably prefer to stay in a different area.

Reviews.Title: “Good, nice and cheep (bueno, bonito y barato)”
Reviews.Author: ezini
Reviews.Content: The staff is nice The appartments have whatever you need, but are small. If youa re going for leisure, it is fine, because you are out of the hotel the most of the time

Reviews.Title: “Unflexible cancellation policy, dirty rooms, unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveller197
Reviews.Content: After seeing good reviews on tripadvisor, I booked this hotel through a travel agent. We were told that their cancellation policy was 1 day prior to arrival. We were meant to stay for a week. When we arrived, the rooms where dirty (food from previous guests rotting away in the fridge, the non-smoking room smelt of smoke, an uncleaned and unflushed! toilet), we were not told where the bins were, so we had a basket of fruit rotting in the room and didn't know how to get rid of it. We complained about it early in the morning after the first night, and were told that they would need to check their cancellation policy with their manager when he is back in office on Monday. However, by Sunday, we decided that we couldn't deal with the shortcomings any more and moved out. The staff was extremely unhelpful and kept the blockbooking for us, instead of offering the room to other guests and thus enabling us to get a refund. I deal with hotels on a regular basis and travel a lot, but this has been the most unhelpful treatment I have received in as long as I can remember. Do yourself a favor and don't stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Excellent Quality”
Reviews.Author: ryanpiller
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights at the Adagio and found it a great base with added bonus of kitchen to help with self catering. Hotel is very new so everything is modern and neat. Soundproofing on rooms is excellent - we didn't hear a person in the hall, a toilet flush or a car outside. Rooms are comfortable with a big bathroom (though like any modern hotel, half the water went on the floor as the screen was inadequate), good linen, decent kitchen with full size fridge, hotplate, microwave oven/grill combo, coffee maker (no filter papers though) etc. Only thing really missing was a toaster but I can hardly complain as there was even a dishwasher! The hotel is near Uhlanderstrasse U-Bahn and you can also walk to Savignyplatz SBahn so there is access to quite a few lines. Plenty of buses too so you can catch one up to Zoo station if you want to get the 100 or 200 that runs to all the main sites. Supermarket just around the corner and plenty of restuarants too. Only real gripe was the Wifi. Available in the lobby but not in rooms. We were given an ethernet cable for the room but that didn't work so we had to go to the lobby any time we wanted to use the internet (a bit annoying over six nights). Can't understand why they just can't make it available in the rooms too - as advertised. Others obviously had the same problem with the supplied cables as the lounge was always full of Wifi users, morning and night. None the less, the Wifi is free.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Adagio Hotels”
Reviews.Author: Jaemi
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after having stayed at the Adagio in Vienna and loving it. We had an excellent experience in this Adagio too. This is definitely a chain that I would highly recommend! Rooms are very spacious, with a well equipped kitchen (including fridge, microwave, plates, etc), modern furnishings, comfortable bed and lovely bathroom (although the water from the shower ends up all over the floor). The shower gel and hand gel are beautiful. There is also a tv, free wired internet, a desk, and airconditioning. The windows are double glazed and the hotel is situated off the main street so is very quiet (although be aware there is currently a construction site next door - this did not affect me at all but my mother was a in a room closer to the site and she was aware of the noise. So maybe request a room away from the site). The hotel is well located between two metro stations although we used the bus to and from the zoologischer gardens (number 149). The stop is only 5 minutes away on the main street and buses come every 10 minutes. We asked at the front desk for restaurant recommendations and they pointed us to a road only 2 minutes walk away that had lots of excellent options. The hotel has one computer available for public use, and a printer. Breakfast is available for 11 euro but we chose to go to the nearby cafes instead. Our apartments were not cleaned during our stay but we liked this, as it gave us more privacy. This is a very clean, modern, comfortable hotel with excellent service and location. I would highly recommend it and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern & stylish aparthotel”
Reviews.Author: vyzas24
Reviews.Content: This is almost exactly what you expect from a brand new, 3-4 star hotel. It opened in October 2009 and is situated one block away from KuDamm, which is awesome, considering it is in the heart of West Berlin’s most vivid area, but some nice meters away from the big avenue. In fact, Adagio’s front is not exactly on Lietzenburger Strasse; the hotel is rather situated adjacent to / behind Abba Hotel, overlooking the core of its city block. This, along with the sound proof windows, insures absolute silence inside the rooms yet leaving no chances for a nice view. The hotel extends to 6 floors, each having around 20 apartments, most of which are for 2 persons and the rest for 3-4 persons. We were a company of 3 and shared one of the bigger apartments for one week during Easter (April 2010). It comprised of virtually 2 rooms, one bedroom (twin beds, following our request) and one small living room with a comfortable sofa bed. These rooms were separated by a retractable door on the wall, offering the possibility to join or separate them at our will, just like a small suite. Each room had a telephone and an LCD TV mounted on the wall. In the living room, there was a desk and a wired Ethernet internet connection free of charge. There was also a small hi-fi system with speakers to be used as a radio, CD player or even plug your own usb stick with mp3s in it. The apartment also featured one stylish bathroom with a bathtub, a separate toilette room (WC) and a small but very well equipped kitchen, with a tall refrigerator, ceramic cooktop, microwave oven, complete set of dishes and glasses, even a dishwasher. You would also not need to bring your hair dryer with you, since there is one available, as well as an iron and ironing board. There is also an electronic safe for your things. We were pleasantly surprised by the modern and stylish furniture and finishing of the apartment and the hotel in general. It is evident that there has been put very good effort to the hotel’s decoration and has been seamlessly combined with materials of good quality. Paying attention to the details, one is unlikely to find anything left to chance or thoughtlessly implemented. This surely applies also to the hotel lobby and breakfast room, with its modern and stylish design, which truthfully, matches the architectural taste of today’s Berlin as a city. Breakfast was adequate; not bad but it could be better, since it lacked anything rememberable. Espresso coffee was not great either. Frankly, next time I visit this hotel, I think I‘ll choose between nearby coffee shops for my breakfast. Transportation wise, the hotel is ideally located. It may be between two metro stations, so you need about 10 min. to reach the nearest one, but you have a bus stop at 5 min. walk on KuDamm and believe me, buses are the best means of transportation in Berlin! They are frequent, there is no traffic whatsoever and you get to see the city on the move! One last note to potential visitors is that cleaning services are not offered as a standard in the apartment price. We stayed for a week and did not require any cleaning services, but if you do, you’d better get more info straight from the hotel during your reservation. Bottom line: This is one great upper class new aparthotel that will satisfy most travelers at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Top Spot”
Reviews.Author: Narara_44
Reviews.Content: Clean,modern,excellent staff and help.Nearby to great pubs and cafes.Fabulous foyer /lounge with comfortable seating/wall map with info about Berlin and attractions.Easy to see where to go and address.Free wireless internet. Accessible coffee bar ,peaceful,quiet area.Stay there definitely.Thumbs up!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A real gem!”
Reviews.Author: tinydancer2010
Reviews.Content: My husband found this hotel, but I was skeptical because it's not close to the main tourist hot spots, but I'm glad to say I am very happy with his choice. It's located just a few blocks from one of the main fine shopping areas, and many restaurants and cafes. It seems that this area is mostly for German or other European visitors, which makes it so much more attractive. Very spacious, modern, and clean and so reasonably priced it is almost unbelievable. Very quiet and very appealing. We have a studio apartment, which although looking small in the photos, is really more spacious than many hotel rooms, with a really nice small kitchen, and spacious bathroom and wardrobes. (FM 91.4 on radio provided is just exceptional!)

Reviews.Title: “easy to access Berlin and good service”
Reviews.Author: Emmastela
Reviews.Content: The staff were very friendly and all welcoming and most helpful when sorting out issue with one of our travel agency (quite rude one). They were very responsive to any requests we had and left us with a very warm feeling. This hotel is nicely located to access Berlin's attractions and also restaurant. Rooms were clean and very clean, which then gave us excellent sleep, and also there is the bar and restaurant which provided the very good service. Will come back !

Reviews.Title: “definately 5 star”
Reviews.Author: jonathan6
Reviews.Content: The Adagio are ultra modern. We have never stayed in such well equipped and luxury apartments. We had a flat screen t.v./hi-fi system. Full size refrigerator,microwave oven & grill, 2 ceramic hobs, coffee maker, dishwasher. there was every conceivable kitchen utensil. The bathroom was very well laid out with full size toiletries. Plenty of wardrobe space. Wood flooring. The other advantage was a supermarket across the street. The staff were very welcoming. The only thing I would say is that it is well signposted but the apartments are behind the Hotel and not on the main street.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly as Advertised, perfect for families and young couples”
Reviews.Author: Haythama
Reviews.Content: The hotel in very modern and clean. we had the 2 bedroom, was quite spacious and modern. Free internet wired in room and wireless in lobby (great advantage), very close to shopping area, supermarket. Staff is very helpful and young. We stayed for about 9 days, we had only 1 free clean scheduled, you can add another at a charge of 25 EUR. In general we enjoyed our stay and would come back again :).

Reviews.Title: “Nice and new, great room !”
Reviews.Author: dana_christian
Reviews.Content: Great room and all is nice and new and the staff is very friendly and helpful. Indeed the bed is a bit hard as mentioned by other people, but we did like our stay in this hotel. Also the bathroom is new and big. The location is good and central in West Berlin. Public Transport is not too close but reachable. Free internet (rooms wired, lobby wireless) and free coffee in the lobby are available. We did not test the breakfast tough. Important to know is that you rent in this hotel services apartments, this means the normal day rate does not include cleaning. Nevertheless you can book this in addition and you will be treated with full hotel services. We enjoyed our stay !

Reviews.Title: “Serviced our needs”
Reviews.Author: Swheel
Reviews.Content: If I ranked this place based on the first room they gave us it would get a big fat 0. They had not cleaned the room and there was someone elses dirty underwear and socks laying about. The floor was filthy and the bathroom was vile, hair in tub and dirt, was disgusting. After we complained they rightly moved us to another room. The 2nd room had at least been cleaned. The room was small but did our needs, the kitchen was handy as we often like to lie in and not be in a rush in the am and want to eat on our time not on the time of any restaurant. So we did use the kitchen, as other has said there was dishwasher, microwave with grill in it, nice size fridge. Pots/pans, tea kettle, coffee maker, stove top with 2 burners, dishes, silverware, even dish soap and tea towel. Bathroom was nice size as well and lovely shower. The bed however was like sleeping on a slab of concrete!! never ever in my life have I been on a harder then a rock bed then they have here. Most beds have a bit of give when you sit or lay on it...not this one..so if you like a stone hard bed then you will love this. As we are not late night people we do like to get early nights, the only english they have on tv is either news or sports...that's it. so take a book It's about 15 min walk to the U train station... There is a computer you can use in the downstairs lounge free of charge and wired internet in rooms that is free. We would stay again just b/c of the kitchen

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodation on super location!”
Reviews.Author: paradaCologne
Reviews.Content: This place gotta be very busy soon since it has everything you would need. I had an apartment ( 38sqm, they said but to me it was like 45sqm) with seperate living- and bedroom, a full kitchen and a good size bathroom with a very good showerhead. Two flat screen TVs with 80 european channels. It only takes 300 meters from the hotel to the 'Ku-Damm' and also to the bus station 109 or the U banh nr.9. If you are going to be in berlin next time, this place is an alternative to hotels, you won't be disappointed if you are looking for a self-catering place to stay.

HotelInfo.Name: Adagio Berlin Kurfurstendamm
HotelInfo.Address: Lietzenburger Str. 89-91, 10719 Berlin, Germany
